actions.committee: House Committee on Public Works and Transportation
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Public Works and Transportation.

official_title: A bill to establish the Federal Protective Service police force within the General Services Administration, provide minimum training, pay, and other benefits for such police force.

summary.text: Establishes a permanent police force within the General Services Administration to be known as the Federal Protective Service. Prescribes the rate of compensation and provides for law enforcement training of members of the Federal Protective Service. Sets forth the duties of such Federal Protective Officers, primarily involving law enforcement within public buildings and other areas under GSA jurisdiction. Includes such officers within Civil Service provisions for immediate retirement of individuals engaged in hazardous occupations; within provisions relating to the absence of police and firemen due to a job-related injury or illness; and within provisions relating to assaults on officers and employees of the United States.

titles.title: A bill to establish the Federal Protective Service police force within the General Services Administration, provide minimum training, pay, and other benefits for such police force.
